pros: Affordable; Impressively stable; Exceptionally well-suited for cold weather; Superior grip on dry roads; Eye-catching colorways available; Lightweight; Environmentally friendly; Versatile across a variety of distances
cons: Poor breathability; Some break-in period needed; 6-mm drop may be too low for some runners
RR_verdict: The Floatride Energy series from Reebok, a trusted favorite among beginner runners, returns with its fifth iteration. This version continues to impress us, delivering a stable, feature-packed, lightweight daily trainer at an attractive price. While it falls short on breathability, in our tests, it provides ample comfort on short and long runs, proving once again its worth as a versatile all-rounder.
